verses.verse: (Prov. 10:23; Jer. 11:15; (Rom. 1:32)) Who rejoice in doing evil, And delight in the perversity of the wicked;
(Ps. 125:5; (Prov. 21:8)) Whose ways are crooked, And who are devious in their paths;
To deliver you from (Prov. 5:20; 6:24; 7:5) the immoral woman, (Prov. 5:3) From the seductress who flatters with her words,
Who forsakes the companion of her youth, And forgets the covenant of her God.
For (Prov. 7:27) her house leads down to death, And her paths to the dead;
None who go to her return, Nor do they regain the paths of life—
So you may walk in the way of goodness, And keep to the paths of righteousness.
For the upright will dwell in the (Ps. 37:3) land, And the blameless will remain in it;
But the wicked will be cut off from the earth, And the unfaithful will be uprooted from it.
Guidance for the Young My son, do not forget my law, (Deut. 8:1) But let your heart keep my commands;
For length of days and long life And (Ps. 119:165; Prov. 4:10) peace they will add to you.
Let not mercy and truth forsake you; (Ex. 13:9; Deut. 6:8; Prov. 6:21) Bind them around your neck, (Prov. 7:3; Jer. 17:1; (2 Cor. 3:3)) Write them on the tablet of your heart,
(1 Sam. 2:26; Luke 2:52; Rom. 14:18) And so find favor and high esteem In the sight of God and man.
((Ps. 37:3, 5); Prov. 22:19) Trust in the LORD with all your heart, (Prov. 23:4; (Jer. 9:23, 24)) And lean not on your own understanding;
((1 Chr. 28:9); Prov. 16:3; (Phil. 4:6; James 1:5)) In all your ways acknowledge Him, And He shall direct your paths.
Do not be wise in your own (Rom. 12:16) eyes; Fear the LORD and depart from evil.
It will be health to your flesh, And (Job 21:24) strength to your bones.
(Ex. 22:29; Deut. 26:2; (Mal. 3:10)) Honor the LORD with your possessions, And with the firstfruits of all your increase;
(Deut. 28:8) So your barns will be filled with plenty, And your vats will overflow with new wine.
(Job 5:17; Ps. 94:12; Heb. 12:5, 6; Rev. 3:19) My son, do not despise the chastening of the LORD, Nor detest His correction;
For whom the LORD loves He corrects, (Deut. 8:5; Prov. 13:24) Just as a father the son in whom he delights.
(Prov. 8:32, 34, 35) Happy is the man who finds wisdom, And the man who gains understanding;
(Job 28:13) For her proceeds are better than the profits of silver, And her gain than fine gold.
She is more precious than rubies, And (Matt. 13:44) all the things you may desire cannot compare with her.
(Prov. 8:18; (1 Tim. 4:8)) Length of days is in her right hand, In her left hand riches and honor.
((Matt. 11:29)) Her ways are ways of pleasantness, And all her paths are peace.
She is (Gen. 2:9; Prov. 11:30; 13:12; 15:4; Rev. 2:7) a tree of life to those who take hold of her, And happy are all who retain her.
(Ps. 104:24; Prov. 8:27) The LORD by wisdom founded the earth; By understanding He established the heavens;
By His knowledge the depths were (Gen. 7:11) broken up, And clouds drop down the dew.
My son, let them not depart from your eyes— Keep sound wisdom and discretion;
So they will be life to your soul And grace to your neck.
((Ps. 37:24; 91:11, 12); Prov. 10:9) Then you will walk safely in your way, And your foot will not stumble.
When you lie down, you will not be afraid; Yes, you will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
(Ps. 91:5; 1 Pet. 3:14) Do not be afraid of sudden terror, Nor of trouble from the wicked when it comes;
For the LORD will be your confidence, And will keep your foot from being caught.
